Author: dpapathanasiou
Content: Greg McAdoo's talk at Startup School is also worth a listen: http://weblava.net/2007-03/startup-school/Startup_School_2007-Greg_McAdoo.mp3

Author: pg
Content: Since Sequoia are fairly good judges, this is not too far removed from being a list of what makes a good startup.

Author: yubrew
Content:
Is this your site? You may also want to check out ParagonLake.com

I spoke to one of the cofounders last week, and they were listed in BusinessWeek as one of the 'Top 25 Entrepreneurs' to look out for. Mass customization is definitely a space where the technology is there, but no one seems to have really implemented it successfully outside of jewelry.

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content:
I agree, I don't see what the point of juwo is in its current form.

There might be a good idea in there somewhere, but it doesn't make me want to download it or try it.

Listen to Greg McAdoo's talk at Startup School -- http://weblava.net/2007-03/startup-school/Startup_School_2007-Greg_McAdoo.mp3 -- particularly the part about solving a problem for "people whose hair is on fire".

I.e., unless you're doing that, no one will care about your product.

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content: He had some interesting things to say, but he could do with a few less quotes like this: "This announcement was at least an 8.0 on the Richter scale."
